Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose:
Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

The Lead Data Scientist within CVS Health is on the front line of driving innovation and directly impacting business decisions. This role is part of a team that works across the Pharmacy Benefits Management ecosystem building analytical cloud-based platforms, supporting pharmaceutical forecasting and pricing. You will have a chance to modernize legacy systems using cutting edge technology. You will work with teammates from our business groups, product management, data engineering, and application development, as well as with your peers from partner data science groups.

This role will create analytics products that are a combination of software, data, and other digital tools providing insights and recommendations to business leaders making tactical and strategic decisions. The analytics products may leverage a combination of descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics approaches.

The ideal candidate will possess a combination of technical experience and subject matter expertise, have a strong knowledge of the healthcare system, and utilize an analytic approach to developing innovative new products and solutions.

Responsibilities:
• Identify opportunities to tighten drug utilization forecasts and modernize an actuarial framework with data science model-based solutions.
• Determine analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and potential future outcomes.
• Develop complex algorithms and statistical predictive models.
• Extract qualitative and quantitative relationships (i.e., patterns, trends) from large amounts of data using statistical and data mining tools.
• Work alongside the data engineering team to assess data quality, clean and organize data, optimize data flow and organization of code, product ionize and scale models.
• Apply analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data using advanced statistical techniques.
• Develop an advanced understanding of the current forecasting system, stakeholders, work products, and identify opportunities for enhancements and support of new initiatives.
• Create a new system to measure the forecast accuracy of current systems.

Required Qualifications
• Familiarity with distributed data and cloud platform computing environments such as Microsoft Azure and GCP
• Experience with time series forecasting and causal modeling techniques
• Advanced knowledge level for SQL
• Knowledge of financial and actuarial concepts related to P&L statements and econometric modeling
• Experience with simulation and optimization techniques and decision support
• Ability to breakdown and clearly define problems, and collaborate as part of a team to design complex solutions
• 5+ years of experience applying modern machine learning techniques to build predictive models for both classification and regression problems using python libraries such as scikit-learn, ml-lib, xgboost, keras etc
• 3+ years’ experience with general linear models, including regression techniques, ensemble models, etc
• 3+ years of experience coding in Python, including pyspark, pandas
• 3+ years’ experience working on projects that include model deployment through an MLOPs model pipeline
• Knowledge of full model development life cycle including EDA, feature engineering, data visualization, model development and deployment, forecast accuracy, model monitoring, model drift

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with Databricks, Vertex

AI, or other modeling platform tools
• Experience with pharmaceutical or other healthcare domain with large administrative claims datasets including their associated code sets, terminologies, and ontologies
• Knowledge of product demand forecasting issues and methods including hierarchical modeling, new customers etc
• Familiarity with Agile concepts and usage of Rally
• Experience working in a matrix environment with multiple collaborating teams and business partners
• Knowledge of Gitlab, containers, databases

Education
• Master’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, Statistics, Health Policy, or other related field
